Articles.Content:
Something that's bothered me for a while.     Why are non-badass Kerbals scared so much?

At the moment, the rule seems to be, look worried

  • any time below 20km
  • whenever an engine is running

It kind of makes sense during rocket launches, which are always,  impressive even when they go right.  In my case, their concerns are justified most of the time.   

However,  boosting away from a Minmus refuelling base to Jool also terrifies most of the Kerbals,  even though we're 6km off the ground , on a steep upward escape trajectory.     The risk here is not so much of crashing into something, rather that the craft never comes into contact with anything solid ever again.    Ah well,   if only i could get my head around orbital math.

Worst of all is when flying aeroplanes and spaceplanes.   Mine tend to be rather sedate,  low TWR, large winged beasts with excessive stability and sluggish controls.   Even my space planes don't go supersonic below 10km,  and climb out at a rather shallow angle.    I can't actually remember the last time I lost a crew member on one, though mission aborts and fails happen a great majority of the time. *

Spoiler

Alright, there was the time I installed a life support addon and had a save file glitch.  Landed an aeroplane in the gently undulating grassland just outside the space centre's peninsula.   Couldn't recover the vessel.    Decided to cut my losses and carry on with career mode.  Several flights later, i got a message that the crew had died from starvation.       I felt terrible, why didn't I try flying a transport with spare seats out to it and bring the Kerbals back, even if the plane was going to have to be left as a monument.    Then again,  why didn't one of the crew just use his cellphone and order a pizza,  or maybe climb out and catch a bus back to the space centre?

 Yet, despite the fact that we're 10km over the water, subsonic, wings level, slowly climbing and not on collision course with anything Bill looks like he needs his Mommy.

On the other hand,  we can be on a fatal plunge towards the ground in a space capsule where the chutes have failed,  or about 2 seconds away from burning up in the re-entry heat, and everyone's happy because the craft isn't under acceleration.    What gives ?

Yeah, having them sitting there screaming their heads off (and scaring each other) annoys me, too. Your company paid big kerbucks to put you on this flight, Mr. VIP. The least you could do would be to try to enjoy it. Sheesh.

I am sure that the Kerbals, when leaving Minmus, are not scared or worried.  They are, in fact, howling and bawling in anguish expecting that their cravings for mint ice-cream will no longer be fulfilled.
well... not everyne feels good while sitting above a lot of high explosive material... in flames...
I like the panic. I always assume Jeb is in the pilot's seat singing a ditty about "lovely kerolox fireballs" over the headsets
I think it give them a "I've been Shanghai'ed into this mission, I should be home sipping mint juleps" vibe.
It's because they're mostly death row prisoners recruited for a second chance.

Well, Bill is smiling here (like an idiot) because he is doing engineer stuff....crying like a baby all through the flight though
